title.narrative: Assistance alimentaire pour sauver des vies et restaurer les moyens de subsistance des ménages affectés par le cyclone ENAWO

description.narrative: The main objective of this joint project is to provide food assistance while supporting targeted households affected by the cyclone Enawo to protect and restore their livelihoods. The total estimated cost of the project is $1,751,073 out of which $717,477 will be allocated to FAO. FAO will procure and distribute 135.05 MT of seeds, 20,778 seed packets of vegetable crops, and 10,389 kits of agricultural commodities for beneficiaries in Antalaha and Maroansetra while WFP will use CERF grant to procure and distribute 1146,99 MT of food for the same population. The project will last six months.

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Assistance alimentaire pour sauver des vies et restaurer les moyens de subsistance des ménages affectés par le cyclone ENAWO

receiver-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS MADAGASCAR RAPID RESPONSE STORM 2017

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
